intro: Cacalia xanthophylla, commonly known as the yellowflower cacalia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Cacalia xanthophylla is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the temperate climate of its native habitat.
